page.title: 01SOUTH SHREWSBURY
page.content: This area contains the majority of {Shrewsbury}south of the town centre. Half the area is built-up whilst the south and eastern outskirts are rural. 2OO years ago settlement would have been based only on the village of {Meole Brace,}the{Shrewsbury}suburb of {Coleham}and the out-lying hamlets of {Betton, Sutton}and{Pulley.}The coming of the railways saw rapid expansion in the{Belle Vue}area whilst the affluent {Kingsland}developed more slowly. Strip development followed along the major roads, the{London Road}and{Wenlock {Road}to the south-east and along the{ {Hereford Road}to the south linking Meole with{Belle Vue.}Following the 195O's council house building at{Meole and{Springfield}there has been infill with the{Sutton}and{Reabrook Estates. Only the hamlets of{Betton}and{Pulley have remained relatively undeveloped.
